Karimnagar falls under the region of Telangana in the Andhra Pradesh state of India. The region falls into the category of a fast developing city with many famous monuments which are in ruins. Karimnagar is one of the 20 most developed districts in India. The famous temple of Lord Raja Rajeshwara Swamy is situated in Vemulawada , the temple of Lord Kaleshwara-Mukteshwara Swamy is situated in Kaleshwaram and  temple of Veera Hanuman is situated in this district.

When in Rome speak Roman...

Probably you would be happy to listen a different accent of Telugu - Mostly widely spoken language in Andhra Pradesh. That is what they call it as

- a language that is a mixture of both Telugu and Urdu. The language is influenced by the rule of Nizams (Muslim kings) in the Telengana region.Urdu is also widely spoken.

The language is simple and shows easiness and love in it.
To get to Karimnagar there are a lot of ways.

Karimnagar has some of the best roads in Andhra Pradesh. It is a major road junction in Telangana region of Andhra Pradesh. It has one of the biggest and busiest bus stations in Andhra Pradesh. It is connected to the state capital, Hyderabad, by Rajiv Rahadari. There are frequent buses from Hyderabad to Karimnagar (once every 10 minutes). It is connected by very good roads with the nearest cities like
and towns like Ramagundam, Mancherial and Kamareddy.

Though Karimnagar is equipped with a railway station, the expansion program is still underway. If you prefer to come to Karimnagar on rail, you can either get down at Warangal (80 km) or Kazipet (80 km) and get a bus from there. Alternatively, you can get down at Ramagundam (70 km) or Peddapalli (40 km) and get a local train which operates from Sirpur Khagaznagar to Jagitial via Ramagundam, Peddapall and Karimnagar. The train runs twice a day and takes more time than on road. So, strong advice is to take a bus from any of the stations mentioned above.

The Biryani Of "Peacock Restaurant" is very famous and is a must try, it is opposite the bus stand, and the two hotels whichs are famous for their "chai" are Majid ki hotel and  Hussain Cafe.

If you in karimnagar at the time of Holy month of RAMZAN, u must have the  "DAHI BADE" OF MUNNU which u find at Sawaran Masjid after Asar prayer, and also the Famous Akbariya  Harees, which you find at Madina Masjid, Mukarrampura.

The other best place to eatout at karimnagar is at Geeta bhavan udipi hotel at mukarrampura chowrasta.

Other Top food Item of karimnagar is Kalyani(beef) Biryani found at many hotels famous are Shazia Hotel, mukarrampura and Taj Hotel, Karkhanagadda.
You will be able to all kind of drinks like cheap liquor to costly foreign liquors in town. If you go to rural areas will be get white liquor extracted from trees which are similar to coconut trees.

In Karimnagar District be careful in remote places like villages. Just enquire about the situation there well before you start. Some remote places in Karimnagar are influenced by Maoists--generally they might not trouble any passerbys or tourists.

Snakes are abundant in Rural areas of Karimnagar so, take care.
